sections.name: Type

sections.body: This Large quadruped is used as a mount and pack animal. Horses can be trained for war but otherwise are skittish around battle. Many cultures support breeding programs and often consider their horse the best at whatever task they breed it to perform.
These horses are often used as portage animals, pulling significant loads across great distances.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Heavy Horse
sections.name: Heavy Horse

sections.body: Heavy warhorses are bred and trained for war. They are often are outfitted with heavy barding, but fight just as fiercely even without the armor.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Heavy Horse (Combat Trained)
sections.name: Heavy Horse (Combat Trained)

sections.body: These horses can be ridden, but often serve as porters or carriage horses.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Light Horse
sections.name: Light Horse

sections.body: These light warhorses are bred for war and are favored by fast and light cavalry, scouts, and daredevil knights.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Equipment/Rules/Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Animals/Mounts/and Related Gear/Horse/Light Horse (Combat Trained)
sections.name: Light Horse (Combat Trained)

sections.body: These creatures are typically used for carting goods along narrow mountain trails or as steeds for young or Small riders.

sections.name: Pony

sections.body: ): Ponies can be trained for war just as effectively as their larger, more mature brethren. Such steeds often serve Small riders that expect to face battle.
